_header: Man to reform thine exile and thy loss
Title(s): Complaint þat Crist maketh of his Passioun
Subjects: complaints; Christ, appeal of, to man; envoys
_description: Lydgate’s ‘Complaint þat Crist maketh of his Passioun’ — fifteen 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc) including 8-line envoy, and various refrains: ‘thynke on my passyoun’ (st. 1-9, 14); ‘syth I am merciable’ (st. 15-19)

BodLauMis683.First Lines:
Man to refourme thyn exil and thy loosfro paradys place of moost
                    plesaunce…
BodLauMis683.Last Lines:
…no bettir socour nor support in your needethan offte thynkyng
                    on crystys passioun
BodLauMis683.Attributed Title: Here is a compleynt þat crist maketh of his passioun (f. 12)

                    place of moste plesaunce…

CULKk16.Attributed Author:
Lydgate (f. 194); Ion lidgate late a monke of the house of Seynt Edmundus
                    of Bery (f. 194)
CULKk16.Attributed Title:
HEre begynneth an holy meditacioun to oure lord criste Ihesu hangyng on the
                    Croose compiled & made by Ion lidgate late a monke of the house of Seynt
                    Edmundus of Bery on whose sowle God haue mercy Amen (f. 194); Here enduth this
                    holy preyere to the lord
